main.track: Bullet Proof.. I Wish I Was

comments.comment: in hindsight i get the impression that the guys really enjoyed themselves that night.. now years later i know that they were going through hell but on this night i can remember thom laughing here and there and the general atmosphere was upbeat. they put on a blinder! maybe it's because perth is so isolated and away from the rest of the world.. our city has this effect on musicians, i've seen it happen time and time again in the past..which makes for great live shows! this was no exception..along with sonic youth playing washing machine here, this was the best show i've seen in my life :) oh yeah..thom seemed amused at the fact that they were about to play creep as an encore, but not in a bummed kind of way. everyone attending had a great time..it was electric!

Whoa, I remember this! A group of us went & queued up for ages outside, tickets in hand.. We had arrived early. Some of us quickly went around the back of the Ent. centre & caught Colin (Greenwood) on his way in, We said G'day, he signed my shorts and some other peoples' clothing and we raced back around to the front of the queue where the rest of the group was and raced into the front railing.
They played one of the most enjoyable and awesome sets I had experienced, and still to this day although my music tastes have changed Radiohead stand out for me & I thank them for giving us kids in Perth a wicked show.
I was 15 then, I'm 21 now.. I heard they are doing another Australian tour in 2004 around April, but they are not coming back to Perth this time. I am saving up money to fly over to Sydney to see them again.
Cheers,
k.
